types.name: Query
types.description: Details the queries available in Hunterer v2

fields.name: now
fields.description: Retrieve the current server time in UTC.

fields.name: me
fields.description: Fetch the currently logged-in user.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
Get one user by personaId or by email address. Will return an error if neither
`personaId` nor `emailAddress` is provided to search by. If both are provided,
`emailAddress` is ignored.

fields.name: admins
fields.description: Fetch a list of all WPN_ADMINs. **Currently only the `personaId` field has real data.**

fields.name: myActiveEvents
fields.description: Get active events of current user.

fields.name: playerStatus
fields.description: Get player event status for current user.

fields.name: playerMatch
fields.description:
Get match information from the round for the current user. Round 0 returns current round data.
Returns empty if no match can be found for player.

fields.name: playerStanding
fields.description:
Get current individual standing information for a given event player.
Returns empty if no standings for that player in that event.

fields.name: users
fields.description: Get data on multiple users using persona ids at once

fields.name: userSearch
fields.description: Query on all available user roles in the system

fields.name: eventPage
fields.description:
Get one page of events for an organization, subject to filtering. Without a filter, returns
the earliest 30 events.

fields.name: eventsInProgress
fields.description: Get events for an organization which are currently in progress.

fields.name: recurrenceEvent
fields.description: Get an event by ID with the recurrence fields present.

fields.name: eventFormats
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available event formats in the selected locale's language.

fields.name: cardSets
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available card sets in the selected locale's language.

fields.name: penalties
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available penalties in the selected locale's language.

fields.name: infractions
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available infractions in the selected locale's language.

fields.name: infractionCategories
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available infraction categories in the selected locale's language.

fields.name: incident
fields.description: Get an incident by ID.

fields.name: gameStateV2AtRound
fields.description: Get a game state at a specified round and ID. Round 0 returns the current round.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: Get an organization by ID.

fields.name: organizations
fields.description: Search for organization by name.

fields.name: organizationsSearch
fields.description: Search for organizations.

fields.name: features
fields.description: Get all available feature flags

fields.name: organizationFeatures
fields.description: Get the feature flags for the given organization

fields.name: allOrganizationFeatures
fields.description: Get all features for the list of organization IDs.

fields.name: venue
fields.description: Retrieve a Venue by ID.

fields.name: twilioAdmins
fields.description: Fetches a list of all TWILIO ADMINS user details

fields.name: brands
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available languages.

fields.name: languages
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available languages.

fields.name: regions
fields.description:
Retrieve a list of all available regions.
These regions are just OrganizationGroups that have been flagged as a region.

fields.name: groups
fields.description: Retrieve a list of all available organization groups that are not flagged as a region.

fields.name: distributorsByGroup
fields.description:
This will return the available distributors for a specific organization group
using that groups id.

fields.name: distributorsByGroups
fields.description:
This will return the available distributors for a the organization group id
array that is provided.

fields.name: searchEvents
fields.description:
Provided that the search query has results this will return a list of events
that match the provided search query and are in the maxMeters range from the
latitude and longitude

fields.name: eventFilters
fields.description:
Pull all of the Event Filters that are currently supported to filter events on.
This is currently just groupings of tags that you can filter on

fields.name: storesByIds
fields.description: Get multiple store information at once by a list of store ids

fields.name: storesByLocation
fields.description: Get multiple store information at once by a list of store ids

fields.name: event
fields.description: Get an event by ID.

fields.name: queues
fields.description: Get all queues fo an event

fields.name: timer
fields.description: Query to fetch a timer by ID.

fields.name: magicCards
fields.description: Search against the database of MagicCards

fields.name: magicCardPrintings
fields.description: Search against the database of MagicCardPrintings

fields.name: magicCard
fields.description: query to fetch a card by id.

fields.name: autoCard
fields.description: query to fetch a card by name , setAbbreviation, language

fields.name: randomCard
fields.description: query to fetch a random MagicCard.

fields.name: magicCardSets
fields.description: query to fetch all MagicCard setNames in English.

fields.name: magicCardOracleSubTypes
fields.description: query to fetch all MagicCard subTypes in English.

fields.name: magicCardOracleSuperTypes
fields.description: query to fetch all MagicCard superTypes in English.

fields.name: magicCardPrintingsArtists
fields.description: query to fetch all MagicCard Printings Artists.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: dropSelf
fields.description: Drop yourself as aplayer from the match / event

fields.name: dropSelfV2
fields.description: Drop yourself as a player from the match / event

fields.name: createEvent
fields.description: Create a new event.

fields.name: updateEvent
fields.description:
Update an event's details. Does not change an event's status; use the specific event status
mutations for that purpose.

fields.name: batchCreateEvents
fields.description: Create multiple events at the same time

fields.name: updateOrganizationEventLocations
fields.description: Update location for all organization active events. Returns the number of events that were updated.

fields.name: createRecurringEvents
fields.description: Creates multiple events using a recurrence.

fields.name: updateRecurringEvents
fields.description: Creates multiple events using a recurrence.

fields.name: deleteRecurringEvents
fields.description: Creates multiple events using a recurrence.

fields.name: createIncident
fields.description: Creates a new incident with associated infraction and penalty for an event.

fields.name: createTeamIncident
fields.description: Creates new incidents for a team of players.

fields.name: updateIncident
fields.description: Updates an existing incident.

fields.name: deleteIncident
fields.description: Deletes an existing incident.

fields.name: sendFeedback
fields.description: Submit user feedback.

fields.name: startEventV2
fields.description:
Start an event. Will update the event status to RUNNING, set its actualStartTime, and (if
the event is a WOTC_DRAFT) perform podding for the first round.

fields.name: endEventV2
fields.description: End an event. Will update the event status to ENDED, and set its actualEndTime.

fields.name: cancelEventV2
fields.description:
Cancel an event. This sets the event status to CANCELLED, but makes no other changes
to the event. In particular, it does not delete it, and does not remove rounds, matches,
results, etc.

fields.name: cutToTop8V2
fields.description:
Cut the event to the top 8. If this is a draft-type event, this will set the event
status to DRAFTING and initialize the `top8Pods` and the three top 8-related
timer fields. If this is a sealed event, this will set the event status to
DECKCONSTRUCTION. For constructed events, this will do nothing (but will do no harm).

fields.name: createNextRoundV2
fields.description:
Create the next round of an event, which might be the first round if none have yet been
created. Returns a GameState.

fields.name: addRoundV2
fields.description: Add a round to the event. This increments the events minimum rounds by 1

fields.name: addTimerV2
fields.description: Add a timer to the GameState, will override any previously set. The timer id is the UUID of the timer.

fields.name: startDraftTimerV2
fields.description: Start the draft timer. Only valid for a draft-type event (e.g., `WOTC_DRAFT`).

fields.name: startDeckConstructionTimerV2
fields.description: Start the deck construction timer. Only valid for a sealed event (e.g., `SEALED_DECK`).

fields.name: startRoundTimerV2
fields.description: Start the round timer.

fields.name: recordMatchResultV2
fields.description:
Record the result of a single match in a round. The result is assumed to be final; that is,
the client should not send game results one at a time as the games are finished, but
instead wait until the match has concluded and send a match score. Returns the current
GameState.
An optional roundNumber can be added to modify a result from the previous round

fields.name: dropTeamV2
fields.description:
Drop a team from the current round. The team will not be paired in the next round, and
any unplayed games will be credited to their opponent (assuming the opponent has not also
dropped).

fields.name: undropTeamV2
fields.description:
Cancel a drop and return the team to the event. This is not the same as a Late Add, and it
should only be used before the round result is certified.

fields.name: dropTeamsV2
fields.description:
Drop multiple team from the current round. The team will not be paired in the next round, and
any unplayed games will be credited to their opponent (assuming the opponent has not also
dropped).

fields.name: certifyRoundV2
fields.description:
Certify the results of a round. A round must be certified before you will be allowed to create the next round.
Returns the current GameState.

fields.name: submitResultsAndCertifyRoundV2
fields.description:
Sumbit results and Certify the round. This mutation asks you to send all of the match results for
the round, even the ones that you previously sent using `recordMatchResult`, and guarantees
that the results you send will be stored and locked to prevent future changes. You **must** call
this mutation before you will be allowed to create the next round. Returns the current GameState.

fields.name: certifyRoundNoResultsV2
fields.description:
Certify the results of a round. This version of CertifyRound does not require result submission to cut down on payload size. You **must** call
this mutation before you will be allowed to create the next round. Returns the current GameState.
fields.deprecationReason: Use certifyRoundV2 instead as it is semantically correct. EoL: 09-30-23

fields.name: removeRoundV2
fields.description: Removes the active round and all match results for that round and moves the Event back to the previous round.

fields.name: setPodPairingTypeV2
fields.description: Sets the PodPairingTypeV2 that will determine the PairingStrategy to be used for a Swiss Draft event

fields.name: setManualPairings
fields.description:
Instead of using the provided pairing's by creating the next round. Manually set the pairings for the current round
Will return the changed pairings only.

fields.name: startEvent
fields.description:

the event is a WOTC_DRAFT) perform podding for the first round.

fields.name: endEvent
fields.description: End an event. Will update the event status to ENDED, and set its actualEndTime.

fields.name: registerInterestedPlayer
expeditePlayersRegistration
fields.description: Moves the selected players from the companion lobby to be registered into the event.

fields.name: lateRegisterCompanionPlayer
fields.description:
Moves the selected players from the companion lobby to be registered into the event after the event has been started.
Because this is after an event has already started the players will also be added to the event in Gamekeeper

fields.name: removeRegisteredPlayer
fields.description:
Remove a player from the registered list. If the player was previously on the interested list,
they will return to it. `id` is the ID of the Registration.

TODO: remove requirement to pass `eventId`

fields.name: registerGuestPlayer
fields.description: Register a new guest (anonymous) player for the event.

fields.name: registerPlayerByEmail
fields.description:
Register a new player for the event, using their email address. We will look up the email in the
platform API to try to match it to a known Wizards account. If we find a match, the new registration
will have status FOUND; otherwise this mutation will return an error.

fields.name: lateRegisterPlayerByEmail
fields.description:
Register a player for an event after registration has concluded, using their email address.
Like initial registration, we will look up the email in the platform API to try to match it
to a known Wizards account, and return an error if we don't find one. If this lookup is
successful, the player will be added to the event and given a match loss in each round that
was paired before the player was added. Players may not be registered late for Draft events
or for Single Elimination events, nor may they be added late once a cut to playoffs has been
made; in each case an error will be returned.

fields.name: lateRegisterGuestPlayer
fields.description:
Register a guest player for an event after registration has concluded. The player will be
added to the event and given a match loss in each round that was paired before the player
was added. Players may not be registered late for Draft events or for Single Elimination
events, nor may they be added late once a cut to playoffs has been made; in each case an
error will be returned.

fields.name: setRegisteredPlayerName
fields.description:
Supply a first and last name for a registered player in the context of a specific event.
This name information is stored temporarily and will be deleted within 7 days of the end
of the event. It does _not_ replace the name information in the Platform system (if any),
and it is not shared between events.

fields.name: setPreferredTableNumber

fields.name: clearPreferredTableNumber

fields.deprecationReason: Use the query on the Event type for 'teams' instead. EoL: 04-30-23

Given a list of strings that can accept both 'emails' and 'displayNames' try and find
the account details for each one in the list and register to them to the 'eventId' given

This will return any failures that were passed in

types.name: PlayerStatus
types.description:
Determines the player status in an event. A player can be either Registered if the TO has added them to the event,
Reserved if the player has reserved a spot in the event but is not yet added, Dropped if the player has been dropped
from the event after the event has started, or None if the player is not in the event

enumValues.name: Registered
enumValues.description: Player has been added to the event by the TO.

enumValues.name: Reserved
enumValues.description: Player has reserved a place, but is not in the event.

enumValues.name: Dropped
enumValues.description: Player has been dropped from the event.

enumValues.name: None
enumValues.description: Player is not in the event.

fields.description: The description of the event.

fields.name: format
fields.description: DEPRECATED. The format of the event. Please use eventFormat instead.

fields.name: limitedSet
fields.description:
DEPRECATED. If this event has a Limited format (such as Draft or Sealed), the set that
will be in use. Please use cardSet instead.

fields.name: rulesEnforcementLevel
fields.description: The Rules Enforcement Level for the event.

fields.name: pairingType
fields.description: The pairing method for the event.

fields.name: entryFee
fields.description: The entry fee for this event, if any. Defaults to zero US dollars.

fields.name: scheduledStartTime
fields.description:
The time that the event is scheduled to begin, for use in calendaring tools. This
is not necessarily the time that the event will actually begin.

fields.name: actualStartTime
fields.description:
The time at which an authorized user started the event. Not necessarily the same
time that its first round began. `null` unless the event has been started.

fields.name: estimatedEndTime
fields.description: An estimate of when the event will conclude.

fields.name: actualEndTime
fields.description:
The time at which an authorized user ended the event. Not necessarily the same
time that its last round ended. `null` unless the event has been ended.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Events are in the SCHEDULED status upon creation and until they are explicitly
started by an authorized user. When they are started, they will transition to
DRAFTING. When the first round is started, the event will move to ROUNDACTIVE
and then ROUNDCERTIFIED once all scores for the round are recorded. It moves
back and forth between ROUNDACTIVE and ROUNDCERTIFIED until the last round
has been certified. When an authorized user ends the event, it will move to
ENDED. An event will be CANCELLED only if it is deleted without ever having
been started.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: The maximum number of players this event supports.

fields.name: numberOfPlayers
fields.description:
The number of players currently registered for this event. This is a simple count
of registrations; does not subtract drops.

fields.name: historicalNumPlayers
fields.description:
The historical number of players that played in this event. This will only be 
populated for events that exceed the max lifespan for event data. Currently 45 days

fields.name: shortCode
fields.description:
A short (generally 6-character) string that uniquely identifies this event. Used
by the player experience for easy event signup.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The tags used by Store and Event Locator for this event.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude of the event's location.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude of the event's location.

fields.name: address
fields.description:
The street address of the event's location. Does not include HTML; uses line breaks for
formatting.

fields.name: timeZone
fields.description: The time zone where the event is being held.

fields.name: phoneNumber
fields.description: The phone number players can call for more information about the event.

fields.name: emailAddress
fields.description: The email address players can use for more information about the event.

fields.name: startingTableNumber
fields.description:
The table number we should start at when assigning matches to tables. Will
default to 1.

fields.name: hasTop8
fields.description: If this event will have a top 8

fields.name: isAdHoc
fields.description: Whether this is an ad-hoc event.

fields.name: isOnline
fields.description: Whether this event is marked as an event that was run online.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The persona id of the user that created this event.

fields.name: requiredTeamSize
fields.description: The number of players per team in the event.

fields.name: groupId
fields.description: If an event was created as part of a group this will have a value. Otherwise it will be null.

fields.name: cardSet
fields.description: If this event has a Limited format (such as Draft or Sealed), the set that will be in use.

fields.name: eventFormat
fields.description: The format of the event.

fields.name: eventTemplate
fields.description: The official event template id that this event is currently using
fields.deprecationReason: Replaced by the eventTemplateId below. Clients should match this to the list of templates they have access to. EoL: SGS->ERS

fields.name: eventTemplateId
fields.description: The id for the event template that this event was created with

fields.name: incidents
fields.description: The incidents that have been reported during this event.

fields.name: gameState
fields.description:
The game state of an event tracks all of the things related to running the
event: pods, pairings, rounds, matches, match results, and standings. May
be `null` if the event is still in `SCHEDULED` status.

fields.name: gameStateAtRound
fields.description: Get a game state at a specified round and ID. Round 0 returns the current round.

fields.name: interestedPlayers
fields.description:
The list of people who have indicated their interest in this event but who
have not yet paid or been registered. Event-Res calls this "reservations."

fields.name: registeredPlayers
fields.description:
The list of people who have paid and been assigned a spot in the event.
Event-Res calls this "registrations."

fields.name: teams
fields.description: Get all the current teams for an event

fields.name: distance
fields.description: This will only have a value if returned from a Search query

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: The default, initial state of a newly-created event: scheduled but not yet active

enumValues.name: PLAYERREGISTRATION
enumValues.description: At least one player has been registered but the event has not yet been paired

enumValues.name: ROUNDREADY
enumValues.description:
Player registration is complete and the first round is ready, with pairings.
Note that this status is not used in a Draft tournament, which has its own
pre-round states.

enumValues.name: DRAFTING
enumValues.description: Player registration is complete and the players have been assigned to draft pods.

enumValues.name: DECKCONSTRUCTION
enumValues.description: Drafting is complete and players are expected to construct their limited deck.

enumValues.name: ROUNDACTIVE
enumValues.description:
A round of the event is currently being played. (You can check the currentRound of
the Event object to find out which round it is.)

enumValues.name: ROUNDCERTIFIED
enumValues.description:
All scores for the most recently played round have been recorded and certified, but the
next round (if any) has not yet begun. Pairings for the next round, if any, are available.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The event was cancelled before play completed.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The event did not start within 7 days of its scheduled start time and has been expired.

enumValues.name: RUNNING
enumValues.description:
(Deprecated) the event is currently active. Replaced by DRAFTING, DECK_CONSTRUCTION,
ROUND_READY, ROUND_ACTIVE, and ROUND_CERTIFIED.
enumValues.deprecationReason: Unused and replaced with the states above. EoL: 04-30-23

types.name: EventFormatEnum
types.description:
The main formats are supported along with OTHER for any format that doesn't fit and
WOTC_DRAFT, a special draft format for WOTC Draft Night.
The description of each enum value gives you the i18n key of the format name.

enumValues.name: WOTC_DRAFT
enumValues.deprecationReason: This is deprecated and should not be used. Use BOOSTER_DRAFT instead. EoL: 04-30-23

types.name: RulesEnforcementLevel
types.description:
Rules Enforcement Levels (REL) are a means to communicate to the players
and judges what expectations they can have of the tournament in terms of
rigidity of rules enforcement, technically correct play, and procedures used.
The description of each enum value gives you the i18n key of the format name.

types.name: PairingType
types.description:
The pairing method of an event is used to determine how players are paired
against each other (except for "player list only", since we do not perform
any pairings at all in that case).

types.name: LimitedSet
types.description:
For Limited events, the specific release set that will be used.
The description of each enum value gives you the i18n key of the format name.

types.name: EventFilter

inputFields.description: Limit search results to events with a specific format.

own pod or another.

(e.g., `WOTC_DRAFT`).

fields.name: top8Pods
fields.description:
The list of draft pod assignments for the event after the cut to top 8. Fairly
redundant, since this will always match the top 8 ranked players (there is only
one pod). Only applicable for a draft formats (e.g., `WOTC_DRAFT`).

fields.name: draftTimerStartTime
fields.description:
The time that the draft timer was started. Only applicable for draft formats (e.g.,
`WOTC_DRAFT`). May be `null` if the event is not drafting or the timer has not
been started.

fields.name: draftTimerExpirationTime
fields.description:
The time at which the draft timer reaches 0. Only applicable for draft formats (e.g.,
`WOTC_DRAFT`). May be `null` if the event is not drafting or the timer has not
been started.

fields.name: draftEndTime
fields.description:
If present, the time at which the draft was ended, that is, the time that the first
round was created. May be `null` if the event is not drafting or the first round
has not yet been created.

fields.name: top8DraftTimerStartTime
fields.description:
The time that the top 8 draft timer was started. Only applicable for draft formats
(e.g., `WOTC_DRAFT`) that have a cut to top 8. May be `null` if the event is
not drafting, there is no top 8 cut, or the timer has not been started.

fields.name: top8DraftTimerExpirationTime
fields.description:
The time that the top 8 draft timer was started. Only applicable for draft formats
(e.g., `WOTC_DRAFT`) that have a cut to top 8. May be `null` if the event is
not drafting, there is no top 8 cut, or the timer has not been started.

fields.name: top8DraftEndTime
fields.description:
(e.g., `WOTC_DRAFT`) that have a cut to top 8. May be `null` if the event is
not drafting, there is no top 8 cut, or the timer has not been started.

If present, the time at which the top 8 draft was ended, that is, the time that the
quarterfinal round was created. May be `null` if the event is not drafting, there
is no top 8 cut, or the timer has not been started.

fields.name: constructionTimerStartTime
fields.description:
The time that the deck construction timer was started. Only applicable for sealed formats (e.g.,
`SEALED_DECK`). May be `null` if the event is not sealed or the timer has not
been started.

fields.name: constructionTimerExpirationTime
fields.description:
The time at which the deck construction timer reaches 0. Only applicable for sealed formats (e.g.,
`SEALED_DECK`). May be `null` if the event is not sealed or the timer has not
been started.

fields.name: constructionTimeEndTime
fields.description:
If present, the time at which the deck construction was ended, that is, the time that the first
round was created. May be `null` if the event is not sealed or the first round
has not yet been created.

fields.name: constructedSeats

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
